result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:56 AM Defendant David H Bonnes not in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for David H Bonnes.  Attorney Jessica Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Deft. is in custody in Illinois.  Defense has reached out to the Illinois atty.  The atty did not respond.  The deft. has court in Illinois on Nov. 2.  Parties ask for one last status.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
ADDRESS INFO for victim party not available

9:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David H Bonnes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for David H Bonnes. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defendant is in custody in Illinois.  Atty Preston has contact info for his Illinois atty.  Atty Preston has an offer from the State and believes this will resolve.  Defense asks for 90 days.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:14 AM Defendant David H Bonnes not in court. Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for David H Bonnes. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. Deft. is in custody in Lake Co. IL.  Deft. will be released after July 19.  Defense asks for a date after that.
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed. Court performs colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

11:28 AM Defendant David H Bonnes in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for David H Bonnes.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. There is a competency report on file that opines the defendant is competent.  Defense is not contesting the finding.  The court questions the defendant.  The defendant agrees with the finding.  The State stipulates to the finding.  BTC: Defendant is competent and this case can proceed.  Defense files a waiver of PH.  
Defense addresses the bond issue.  The court has signed an order to modify the bond to a signature bond.  There is a pending extradition in Illinois.  Defense is asking to have the bond be sent to the jail. If the defendant is released he will be checking into treatment with the help of his father if he is not extradited, if he is extradited atty Preston will keep in contact with the Illinois atty.  BTC: The court will send the bond today.  Court admonishes the defendant.
Order regarding bond (court to address bond on 04-22 at hearing as defendant has an extradition hold)
on bond
on bond
